author: daniellehrner
content: Is there any reason  to keep the `engine_exchangeTransitionConfigurationV1` RPC endpoint? If not, wouldn't it make sense to remove it with the Shanghai hardfork?

author: bridge-bot
content: <parithoshj> I guess the only reason is that the users can be sure their EL and CL are on the same network, we could probably modify it to get rid of TTD info or optimize it to be a generic heartbeat.

author: tersec
content: Also, the engine API isn't on the Capella/Shanghai release schedule necessarily -- one can update it separately

author: daniellehrner
content: It can be updated separately, but we still need to coordinate it between all the EL an CL clients. If not we would cause a lot of warnings in the logs if one EL client were to remove it, but the CL clients still try to call it.

author: tersec
content: this approach breaks circular dependencies to progressing on this

author: tersec
content: If people want a generic heartbeat message, there are better approaches than reusing this one

author: tersec
content: next step might move CL sending to `SHOULD NOT`, for example
